results.title: Ken's great times with Legacy
results.creator_credit: Ken Hellnig, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Ken joined Legacy after his dad’s death. He went on the first Legacy camp in his early 20s and he shares with us his years with Legacy, the camps, day trips, boating adventures and the friends made over the years.

results.title: Anne's Legacy
results.creator_credit: Dulcie Cedaro, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Encouraged by her daughter, Anne, to get out there and keep busy, Dulcie started to volunteer. Through the volunteer work, Dulcie remembered her time at Legacy when she was 12 and decided to join up again. This restored her quality of life and brought her back in contact with the community that would provide support after Anne died.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dulcie Cedaro, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: The Bribe
results.creator_credit: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines: The Shrine of Remembrance
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After Pat Vines returns from the war as a Commander of the Australian Navy, one of her senior navy officers recommends her to the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees, which she joins. She tells of her time as a Trustee for the Shrine.

results.title: Darling Darling
results.creator_credit: Sam Smith, Bridget Ikin and Gabriella Hirst
results.credit_line:
Gabriella Hirst
Two-channel video installation, digital video, sound, 25:30 mins.
SanDisk Memory Card, gold leaf, in collaboration with Barbara Dabrowa, AGNSW Senior Conservator of Fine Arts – Frames
Courtesy the artist
Ian Potter Moving Image Commission, ACMI Collection
results.material_description: Two-channel video installation, digital video, sound and gilded SD card
results.brief_description:
Darling Darling presents two contrasting but linked responses to the idea of conservation. One side of the screen shows the meticulous care taken to restore WC Piguenit’s prized 1895 painting of the Barka-Darling River, The flood in the Darling, 1890, while the other side reveals the present-day neglect of the river itself. Excess upstream water diversion and climate change have contributed to severe water scarcity and mass fish kills in recent years.

In composing her shots of the river, Hirst references Australia’s beloved landscape painting tradition, and colonial-era artists like Eugene von Guérard, John Glover, Conrad Martens, Nicholas Chevalier, Ludwig Becker and of course, WC Piguenit. While their romantic paintings capture a sense of nature as awe inspiring, they also served the more material purpose of framing resources to be owned and exploited by European settlers, a visual expression of the concept of terra nullius.

Darling Darling invites us to question the role played by Western visual art traditions in shaping the value systems that allow such an extreme environmental crisis to unfold right before our eyes.

Gabriella Hirst (she/her) is an artist. She was born and grew up on Cammeraygal land (Australia) and is currently living between Berlin and London. She works primarily with moving image, performance, and with the garden as a site of critique and care. Gabriella’s practice and research explores connections between various manifestations of capture and control – spanning plant taxonomies, landscape painting, art conservation and nuclear history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Smith, Bridget Ikin and Gabriella Hirst

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.
results.description: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.

results.title: An Interview with Norm Smithells
results.creator_credit: Norm Smithells and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.
results.description: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.

results.title: An Interview with Douglas Margetts
results.creator_credit: Douglas Margetts and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.
results.description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.

results.title: An Interview with Bill Saunders
results.creator_credit: Bill Saunders and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Bill Saunders joined the Airforce with his brother when both were called up in 1941. He shares stories from this time, about his training and posting in Europe as a pilot during World War II. In his time, he flew Tigermoths and the Ansons.
results.description: Bill Saunders joined the Airforce with his brother when both were called up in 1941. He shares stories from this time, about his training and posting in Europe as a pilot during World War II. In his time, he flew Tigermoths and the Ansons.

results.title: An Interview with Allan Couper
results.creator_credit: Allan Couper and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Allan Couper is a Victorian World War II veteran. He served as a pilot in Europe as part of the Bomber Squadron. As part of the Digital Storytelling project “In our words”, Allan relates his experiences of fighting in Europe during the war.
results.description: Allan Couper is a Victorian World War II veteran. He served as a pilot in Europe as part of the Bomber Squadron. As part of the Digital Storytelling project “In our words”, Allan relates his experiences of fighting in Europe during the war.
